Description: Green glazed composition reis shabti of Osorkon with a black curled page-boy wig, a protuberant modelled face, a garment with a deep v-neck and a pleated triangular apron, one arm is held across the body and holds the handle of a whip and the other arm hangs down the side, the back is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs, the section below the knee is missing.
Curator's comments: Moje, DieWelt des Orients, 41. Jahrgang, S. 69–78 (assigns shabti to High Priest of Ptah Osorkon A, and associated with two Petrie Museum shabtis, UC 40045a-b)
